Name: Figurine of Harpocrates and the Elephant
Description: The small terra-cotta shows Harpocrates mounting an African elephant led by a child. The figurine was covered with plaster and colored in red. Harpocrates was frequently portrayed riding on the back of an elephant, recalling the victory of Dionysos against India. The museum includes numerous clay and bronze statues showing Harpocrates in his varied forms. Most of them date to the Roman period.
